To go into the *Desktop* application, simply click *Desktop* on the *Administration* bar. You will be directed to the Desktop user interface as below:

!images/WebOS-screen.png|align="center" width="150mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

||Number||Meaning||
|!images/no1.png|scalefit="1" width="4mm"!|The administration bar which allows you to access and manage tasks quickly.|
|!images/no2.png|scalefit="1" width="4mm"!|The background of Desktop.|
|!images/no3.png|scalefit="1" width="4mm"!|The Dockbar which provides easy access to applications via icons.|
|!images/no4.png|scalefit="1" width="4mm"!|The application icons which are used as shortcuts to gadgets, applications or pages.|
|!images/no5.png|scalefit="1" width="4mm"!|The application.|

In the Desktop, you can do the following actions:

* [Add an application to the Dockbar|#WebOS_userguide.Manage_applications.Add_application]
* [Open an application|#WebOS_userguide.Manage_applications.Open_application]
* [Quit an application|#WebOS_userguide.Manage_applications.Quit_application]
* [Change the Desktop title and background|#WebOS_userguide.Manage_applications.Change_title_background]

h1. Add an application {anchor:id="WebOS_userguide.Manage_applications.Add_application"}

*1.* Open the *Add Application* form via one of two ways:

*The first way*

Hover your cursor over the Dockbar and click the *Add Application* icon.

!images/Add_Application_from_Dockbar.png|align="center" width="100mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*The second way*

Right-click any area inside the Desktop background and select *Add Application* from the drop-down menu.

!images/Drop-down-menu-desktop-page.png|align="center" width="70mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

The *Add Application* form will appear.

!images/Add_application_form.png|align="center" width="100mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*2.* Select a category on the left pane. The applications of this category will be shown on the right pane.

*3.* Click !images/Add_application_button.png|scalefit="1" width="4mm"! corresponding to your desired application. Your selected application is then automatically added to the Dockbar.

h1. Open an application {anchor:id="WebOS_userguide.Manage_applications.Open_application"}
* To open an application, hover your cursor over the Dockbar and click your desired application icon. The hovered icon will display the application name, allowing you to recognize your desired application easily.

!images/Open_Application.png|align="center" width="100mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

The application window will be shown on the Desktop. When an application is running, !images/Running_application_icon.png|scalefit="1" width="6mm"! will appear right under its icon on the Dockbar to indicate that application is running.

!images/Opened_application.png|align="center" width="100mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

* To minimize the running application window, click !images/Window_minimize_icon.png|scalefit="1" width="4mm"! on the info bar of the application or !images/Show_hide_application_icon.png|scalefit="1" width="4mm"! on the Dockbar. !images/Running_application_icon.png|scalefit="1" width="4mm"! is remained, stating that the application is still running.
* To show the running application window, click !images/Show_hide_application_icon.png|scalefit="1" width="4mm"! or the application icon on the Dockbar.
* To maximize the opened application window, click !images/maximize_button.png|scalefit="1" width="4mm"! on the info bar of the application to view its full size. !images/maximize_button.png|scalefit="1" width="4mm"! will be changed into !images/Restore_icon.png|scalefit="1" width="4mm"!. Click !images/Restore_icon.png|scalefit="1" width="4mm"! if you want to restore to the original size of the application.
* To reset a changed application, right-click any area outside the application window and select *Refresh.*

h1. Quit an application {anchor:id="WebOS_userguide.Manage_applications.Quit_application"}

*The first way*

Click !images/quit_icon.png|scalefit="1" width="4mm"! at the right top of the application window.

*The second way* 

Right-click the application icon on the Dockbar and select *Quit.*

!images/Quit_dockbar.png|align="center" width="100mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*The third way* 

This way allows you to close all running applications. Right-click any empty area on the desktop page and select *Close All* from the drop-down menu.

!images/Close_all.png|align="center" width="70mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

The icon !images/Running_application_icon.png|scalefit="1" width="6mm"! will disappear after the running application has been closed.

h1. Change the Desktop title and background {anchor:id="WebOS_userguide.Manage_applications.Change_title_background"}

First, right-click any area on the Desktop background.

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para><emphasis role="bold">Change the title</emphasis></para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

*1.* Select *Page Title* from the drop-down menu.

*2.* Enter your desired new name into the *Page title* field, and click *Save* to accept your change.

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para><emphasis role="bold">Change the background</emphasis></para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

*1.* Select *Change Background* from the drop-down menu.

All available images for the Desktop background are displayed in the *Choose Background Image* form.

!images/Background_form.png|align="center" width="100mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*2.* Click !images/Preview_background_icon.png|scalefit="1" width="4mm"! to preview your background.

*3.* Click !images/select_background_icon.png|scalefit="1" width="4mm"! to select and apply the relevant background. 

* To get the default background again, click the *Get Default* link at the right corner of this form.

* Also, from this form, you can do the following actions:

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para><emphasis role="bold">Delete any background</emphasis></para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

Click !images/Delete_icon.png|scalefit="1" width="4mm"! corresponding to the background you want to delete.

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para><emphasis role="bold">Upload an image from your local device</emphasis></para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

*1.* Click the *Upload* button at the bottom of the *Choose Background Image* form. The *Upload Images* form will appear.

!images/Upload_form.png|align="center" width="100mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*2.* Click *Browse...* to locate the image you want to set as background image and upload it.

After the image is uploaded, you can click !images/Add_icon.png|scalefit="1" width="4mm"! to add more another image, or !images/Delete_icon_blue.png|scalefit="1" width="4mm"! to delete the uploaded image.

!images/Add_more_delete.png|align="center" width="100mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*3.* Click *Save* to accept your upload, or *Back* to go back to the previous step.
